other_tests.findings: CSF contained 4 red cells and 188 white cells per cubic millimeter, with 88% lymphocytes, 5% segmented neutrophils, and 7% monocytes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: On repeat lumbar puncture, showed an increased number of lymphocytes with admixed neutrophils, macrophages, and occasional plasma cells.

other_tests.findings: Portable electroencephalography revealed generalized rhythmic delta activity and bifrontal triphasic waves, with diffuse irregular deltaâ€“theta slowing.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Improvement in generalized rhythmic delta activity was noted after administration of Lorazepam.

other_tests.findings: CSF revealed yellow color, elevated protein (275 mg/dl), and abundant polymorphonuclear neutrophils.
other_tests.changes_over_time: CSF findings progressed with increased white-cell count and dominance of neutrophils.
